org.jcatapult.scaffolder
Class AbstractScaffolder

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.scaffolder.AbstractScaffolder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Scaffolder
public abstract class AbstractScaffolder
extends Object
implements Scaffolder

This class is an abstract scaffolder implementation that provides a number of good utility methods that scaffolders might find useful.

Author:
Brian Pontarelli

Constructor Detail

AbstractScaffolder

public AbstractScaffolder()
Method Detail

setDir

public void setDir(File dir)
Sets the directory on the file system that the scaffolder is defined in. This directory can be used by the scaffolders to find additional files such as templates.

Specified by:
setDir in interface Scaffolder
Parameters:
dir - The scaffolder's home directory.

setOverwrite

public void setOverwrite(boolean overwrite)
Sets whether or not the scaffolder should overwrite files during execution.

Specified by:
setOverwrite in interface Scaffolder
Parameters:
overwrite - The overwrite flag.

getType

protected ClassType getType(String className)
This method parses the given Java class into an AST representation using the APT engine shipped with JDK 1.6.

Parameters:
className - The name of the class to locate.
Returns:
This returns the Type for the class name supplied. If that Type could not be found, null is returned.

executeFreemarkerTemplate

protected void executeFreemarkerTemplate(String template,
                                         String output,
                                         Map parameters)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         freemarker.template.TemplateException
Executes the given freemarker template file, passing to the file the Map of parameters.

Parameters:
template - The template file name (i.e. foo.ftl). This should be either a fully qualified path to the template file or relative from the current running directory.
output - The file to place the output.
parameters - The Map of parameters.
Throws:
IOException - If the FreeMarker configuration could not be loaded or the template could not be loaded.
freemarker.template.TemplateException - If the template execution resulted in any type of error.

getFirstPackage

protected String getFirstPackage(String token)
This method attempts to find the first package in the project's main source tree (src/java/main) that contains the given token. For example, if the token is foo and there is a package named com.example.foo, this method will return that package.

Parameters:
token - The token to match.
Returns:
The package or null if the token doesn't match.

ask

protected String ask(String question,
                     String message,
                     String error,
                     String defaultValue)
              throws IOException
Calls ask(String, String, String, String, jline.Completor) passing in the ClassNameCompletor.

Parameters:
question - The question to ask.
message - The message to give if the question is correctly answered.
error - The error to display if the question is incorrectly answered (left blank).
defaultValue - The default value to use (if the user leaves their answer blank.
Returns:
The answer or the default value and never null or empty String.
Throws:
IOException - If the ClassNameCompletor could not lookup the classes.

ask

protected String ask(String question,
                     String message,
                     String error,
                     String defaultValue,
                     jline.Completor completor)
Continues to ask the user a question until it gets a good answer. This uses the JLine command line reading interface and currently uses the ClassNameCompletor for tab completion.

Parameters:
question - The question to ask.
message - The message to give if the question is correctly answered.
error - The error to display if the question is incorrectly answered (left blank).
defaultValue - The default value to use (if the user leaves their answer blank.
completor - The JLine completor to use.
Returns:
The answer or the default value and never null or empty String.

makeSimpleClassName

protected String makeSimpleClassName(String qualifiedClassName)
Converts the fully qualified class name (including the package name) to a simple name that only contains the class name.

Parameters:
qualifiedClassName - The fully qualified class name.
Returns:
The simple class name.

makePropertyName

protected String makePropertyName(String simpleClassName)
Based on the simple class name, this creates a property name that can be used for variables within classes. For example, FooBar is converted to fooBar.

Parameters:
simpleClassName - The simple class name, without the package.
Returns:
The property name.

makeURL

protected String makeURL(String simpleClassName)
Based on the simple class name, this creates a URL that is the same convention as the SEO URL generation from the Struts2 convention plugin. This breaks on camel case, inserts dashes and lower cases everything.

Parameters:
simpleClassName - The simple class name, without the package.
Returns:
The URL.

makePackageName

protected String makePackageName(String dashedURL)
Based on the simple class name, this creates a URL that is the same convention as the SEO URL generation from the Struts2 convention plugin. This breaks on camel case, inserts dashes and lower cases everything.

Parameters:
dashedURL - The simple class name, without the package.
Returns:
The URL.
